title: Concave mirror - image distance when object moves

content.question: An object is located a distance <math alttext="d sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from a concave mirror, as shown in the figure. The image formed by the mirror is located the same distance <math alttext="d sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the mirror, as indicated. The object is then moved a short distance farther from the mirror to a new position that is a distance <math alttext="d sub o new, end sub, is greater than d sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>o-new</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the mirror.
